reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: Responsible internationalization- project has two goals that complement each other: To develop the international competencies and skills and relevance of global responsibility of students from Turku University of Applied Sciences (TUAS) and from Satakunta University of Applied Sciences (SUAS) hence supporting possibilities of Internationalization at Home and recognizing one's role and significance in the international multicultural society. The project is a joint effort by the Student Union of TUAS (TUO) TU AS the Student Union of SUAS (SAMMAKKO) and SUAS in which mutual operations model will be created in order to highlight knowledge of Home Internationalisation and the benefits and opportunities of development cooperation. Through the networks of the cooper ants regional businesses who value international skills and global responsibility will be benchmarked and linked to the project.The activities will take place on two levels: By using the already existing low-bar activities and events and by integrating the mes of the project to study modules of the universities. Key themes in teaching are correlations between commerce environment health and development and taking these into account on both individual and community level. Both approaches create new ways of th inking and a new attitude towards internationality development cooperation and global responsibility on students' own language and terms. The project methodology is innovation pedagogy which emphasizes student based learning. The aim is to support and incr ease communication between students during teaching as well as in informal activities. Including the exchange students in the project is an important factor. The project supports the Internationalization Strategy of the Universities and the global responsi bility of the multicultural society and is possible to extend to other universities of applied sciences after the pilot project.
